entries.title: Zelensky Urges Ukrainians to Remain Unified
entries.description: On a day meant to mark the unification of Ukraine in 1919, the country’s leader said it was vital for Ukrainians of all regions to bind together.

entries.title: Your Monday Briefing: A Lunar New Year Shooting
entries.description: Also, New Zealand’s next leader and a Lunar New Year travel surge in China.

entries.title: Russian Agents Suspected of Directing Far-Right Group to Mail Bombs in Spain
entries.description: U.S. officials say the operation may be a signal by Russia that the country and its proxies could carry out more terrorist actions in Europe if nations continue supporting Ukraine.

entries.title: Peru’s Deadly Protests
entries.description: A failed coup attempt set off unrest that has immobilized the country.

entries.title: Netanyahu Fires a Top Minister to Comply With a Supreme Court Ruling
entries.description: Aryeh Deri, who has a conviction for tax fraud, was deemed unfit to serve in the government, leaving Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in a legal and political predicament.

entries.title: I.V.F. Offers Hope in China, Even to the Government
entries.description: China is trying urgently to address its declining population. One idea is to subsidize assisted fertility procedures, which are often a last resort for couples and out of reach for many.

entries.title: Germany’s Reluctance on Tanks Stems From Its History and Its Politics
entries.description: A post-Nazi aversion to war and a commitment to promoting peace through engagement combines with an old fixation on Russia and a deep aversion to leading militarily.

entries.title: In a Nation That Nearly Wiped Out Cholera, the Disease Is Surging Back
entries.description: Malawi, in southern African, had all but eradicated cholera, recording only two cases in 2021. But more than 900 people died of it over the past 11 months, and the government is scrambling to contain its spread.

entries.title: Is Brazil’s Alexandre de Moraes Actually Good for Democracy?
entries.description: Alexandre de Moraes, a Brazilian Supreme Court justice, was crucial to Brazil’s transfer of power. But his aggressive tactics are prompting debate: Can one go too far to fight the far right?

entries.title: China Celebrates Lunar New Year After ‘Zero Covid’ With Caution
entries.description: With strict Covid restrictions lifted weeks ahead of the country’s most important holiday, millions, joyful yet anxious, could finally travel and reunite with family.
